description: Just arrive this rare hard to find 1971 Ford Torino 2 Door Hard Top With the Original 302 Engine Automatic Trans with Power Steering and rare Disc Brakes (stops on a dime) Rally wheels, Raised white lettered tires. This is a good solid car in storage most of it life.....the older paint job still looks good! The original interior looks great two small open seams......this is a great driver that stops traffic at any show!!! Low miles runs and looks great!!

With its smooth running and powerful drivetrain, muscle car configuration and near full-size stature, this 1969 Ford Torino GT occupies a unique niche among classic cars and would be a great acquisition for someone looking for a head turning ride that not only has undeniable vintage curb appeal but is also well-suited for frequent driving.

Torinos had been a premium designation for Ford's respected Fairlane line for some time, but as the '60s were drawing to a close, the manufacturer chose to put an increasing amount of distance between them and the more modestly-equipped Fairlane variations. You can see that the Torino represents an obvious blending of muscle car sensibilities into a more sizable form - a sort of supersized muscle car.  Besides some of the more directly muscle car inspired styling cues, like the low profile hood scoop, it has a more flowing shape than most of the cars of its time. The front windshield has a pronounced angle to it, and the rear roofline gradually descends from rear windshield to deck lid. Its light ivy yellow paint replaces the lime color it began with. It's a more subtle shade than the original and, as it's very close to the meadowlark yellow color offered when this Torino was new, looks very era-appropriate. This remains a well-put together car - its doors and hood open and shut smoothly, its front and rear bumpers sit nice and level and its exterior badging is intact and well-secured.

The black vinyl interior is both well-preserved and a great example of late '60s automotive styling. The wide-backed bucket seats that sit in place of the more common bench seat of the time are really comfortable, as is the bench seat in back, and both are in good shape, with no threadbare areas or tears. This is certainly a vintage classic ride that thoroughly lends itself to group outings, as there's all kinds of room in back for your rear seat passengers. Just beyond the original steering wheel sits a dash area with a great, singular look. No fewer than four individual pods make up the instrument cluster, whose factory-issued gauges remain easily readable, and an AM radio sits surrounded by a wood grain panel for just the right nostalgic vibe. The unusually spacious trunk area is in good order - its floor is lined with Ford plaid fabric and its trunk walls and wheel wells show no obvious dings. Even with a full-size spare residing on the trunk floor, there's still plenty of room for luggage.

OK, the real reason this Torino GT is special can be found under the hood: a 351 cubic inch V8. It's been augmented by a Weiand intake manifold, Holley 4-barrel carburetor, and an aluminum radiator, but the rest appears to be pretty original. The stock look is augmented by a set of chrome valve covers and air cleaner lid, which also wears a reproduction decal. It's pretty tidy under the hood with easy service access, even with those long-tube headers. The 3-speed FMX transmission has been rebuilt and the beefy 9-inch rear just shrugs it off when you hammer the throttle. New components include a new timing chain and cover, water pump, shocks, and aluminum radiator. A Flowmaster dual exhaust system gives it an awesome Ford small block sound and you'll be impressed by how tidy it looks underneath for a mostly original car. Classic styled steel wheels offer a more sporting look than plain old steelies and it wears 215/60/14 BFGoodrich T/A radials all around.
This is a fun, affordable Ford that delivers in all the ways that matter. Who says Chevy guys get all the breaks? Call today!

1973 FORD GRAN TORINO SPORT FASTBACK Q CODE COBRA JET……….. Ok now that's a mouth full.   But if there was ever a car that deserved a mouth full of a name, this just might be the one. This is one super bad ass 1973 fastback muscle car. If you want tough, if you want cool, if you want to make a statement anywhere you go…….. this is the big, bad, car for you. If you follow our sites, you know that the 72 and 73 Gran Torino Sport Fastback is my all-time favorite car. I drive a 1972 Gran Torino Sport Fastback every day, and we have sold several over the last few years. These cars look super tough, they ooze muscle car out of every pore, and they are about the finest driving cars, that you can every enjoy driving.  This however is something special. This 1973 Gran Torino Sport Fastback is the very first Q code Cobra Jet car that we have ever had. These are very rare cars, and very hard to find with a Q code Cobra Jet Vin tag. We purchased this beauty with its new Bright Red paint, brand new built 351 Q code cobra Jet motor, brand new built Transmission, and new wheels and tires. We were told that the gentleman spent over $10,000 on the motor build alone. Believe me when I say, this is one very fast, very tough , very cool car, with an absolute new fresh built motor, tranny, paint, and a really big fancy stereo system?  We added a new vinyl top, and new factory correct laser stripe, and “ WOW” what a car!!  This is a great looking, great driving muscle car on every level. If you are looking for beautiful tough muscle car, that will grab attention at any rally, show, or just cruising down the road. Believe me when I say, this is it. These 73 Torino Sport fastbacks are very hard to find, and with the Q code Cobra Jet, almost impossible. At Cool Classic Rides, we take great pride in offering for sale, some of the nicest daily driver classics available, at a price that we believe to be the best in the country. We are trying very hard to bring a new generation of people into the classic car world.  We want to see more of these classics on the road, not sitting in a garage waiting for a once a year show, but on the open road, being driven and enjoyed, like they should be. This 73 beast is no exception. Offered for sale at $18,500.00  this is a great price for a Cobra Jet car. Look around and compare  what else you can get for that price ?? Then give us a call. We always recommend a private viewing or professional inspection on all our cars, before you purchase. The Atlanta Showroom is offering this 1968 Ford Torino GT.  This SportsRoof 302 Torino has a 3-speed automatic transmission and an original feel.  In 1968 Ford Motor Company introduced its intermediate line with a new body and new styling. Along with the new body and styling came a new subseries in the Fairlane line the Torino.  Styling was all new for the 1968 Fairlane/Torino and it was drastically changed from the 1967 models. The new intermediate had grown in size and weight and a new fastback model was added. The front fascia featured a full width recessed grille with horizontal quad headlights placed at the outer edges. Horizontal dividing bars were featured in the grille depending on the model. Parking lights were placed at the outer edge of the front fenders and wrapped around the corner to also act as side marker lights (a new requirement in 1968). The body sides were smooth with one horizontal body crease running just below the beltline from front to back. The taillights were rectangular in shape and vertically situated in the rear panel above rear bumper. Reverse lights were located in the middle of the taillights and small side marker lights were located on the rear edge of the quarter panel. Fastback models which Ford called SportsRoof featured a slightly concaved rear taillight panel unique to that body style. The new SportsRoof body style featured a gently sloped long roof line that extended to the edge of the trunk lid. This new fastback body style gave the Fairlane and the Torino excellent aerodynamics that would later prove to be advantageous on the race track. Options include: AC Hub caps radial tires seat belts and vinyl interior.  This To view the car in greater detail including 100+ HD photos and HD video please visit www.gatewayclassiccars.com. For more information please call the Atlanta showroom at 678-894-4833.

More pictures coming soon.   Oveseas buyer, and dealers welcome.  Contact us to set up an appointment to see the car.  Joe, 630-841-6353.
1972 Ford Torino Coupe

The 1972 Torino was redesigned and featured an even more exaggerated ''long hood, short deck'', coke bottle styling. The most noticeable change was the large eggcrate grille in an oval opening in the Gran Torinos. The Torino had aggressively flared front fenders, the rear fender line swept up towards the roof, and the windshield had a 60-degree rake. The roofline and A-pillars were thinner without sacrificing structural integrity.

Ford reduced the number of models from 14 to 9. The convertible was discontinued. The Torino remained the entry-level model, but the mid-level Torino 500 was renamed Gran Torino, and the Torino GT became Gran Torino Sport. The Cobra model was discontinued as the Torino line was focused more on luxury than performance.

Can you say survivor? Well that's what this very well cared for 1972 Ford Grand Torino is. Under the hood you'll find a 351ci Cleveland engine that has everything on it as it came from the factory, backed up to the 351 is a three-speed transmission. This car is equipped with power steering, power disc brakes and air conditioning. It is a very rare color code 4S Light Green, with black cloth/vinyl interior. This color wasn't available until 1973, but this was a late production date in July of 1972 which is how it received the light green color. A lot of documentation comes with the car to include the build sheet, warranty ID owner card, warranty facts book, original owner's manual, consumer information sheet, emissions system warranty and maintenance schedules, and the original dealership brochure booklet. The car still has a lot of the assembly line inspection stickers still on it. Check this car out today and buy a true time capsule.

title: 1973 Ford Torino Fast Back Sport Q Code

description: As many of you know, that follows Cool Classic Rides. We are always searching the country for very clean and very original; unmolested, classic automobiles. We spend many hours every week, trying to find the one that has been sitting in a storage facility or barn for many years.

Well, I am very happy to say that this time we have found exactly that. What we have here is a 1973 Ford Gran Torino Sport Fastback, with a factory, untouched, and original Q code 390 Cobra Jet V8, with original build sheet. These are very rare cars. We know, because we buy and sell more of them than just about anybody, and the q code Cobra Jet fastback, is a very rare find. Now let's talk about this beautiful original one family car. This amazing muscle car was purchased new in 1973; in 1975 it was sold to the brother of the original owner. This amazing car was then driven by that young man until 1984, at which time it was put in dry storage, and did not move until we purchased it in the winter of 2017. This amazing time capsule, was sitting untouched for 33 years. When we bought it, it was in its original paint, with original interior and original engine. This 73 Torino Sport was as straight as could be, and very nice. We had this muscle car, repainted back to original color, had new front seat upholstery done ( back seat has never been sat on ) new headliner, new carpet, had a new vinyl top put on ( very rare original blue color code) added new laser stripe( also factory correct) new gas tank, rebuilt carb, and new wheels and tires.  As allot of you know, this is my very favorite body style of any car ever built. I think the 1972- 1973 Gran Torino Sport Fastback is as tough and as pure muscle as any car ever was. These cars are getting very rare, and very hard to find. Add to that fact, the Q code Cobra Jet V8, is a one owner car. This is an amazing find, for any collector, or true car enthusiast. This is my favorite color combination of any Torino we have owned. She runs and drives great, with only 67,000 original miles, this is one amazing Torino. We have a full Marti report on this great machine, showing only 900 ever built in this color combination.  If you are looking for a car that will make you and anybody in it look and feel cool, I'm telling you this is it. These are just plain, BAD ASS cars, and this one tops the charts. This body style has “a don't mess with me attitude” that plain screams tough.  If you are in the market for a very rare, tough car, that not everybody owns, this might be just the ticket. These fastback Torino's are going up in value every day. We have priced this beautiful car at $22,500.00 I don't believe this car, in this condition, with these original miles can be bought anywhere for that price, and if you find one buy it. They are going fast. At Cool Classic Rides, we sell nice daily drivers, that you can take out on any back road or forgotten by way. We don't sell TV trailer queens, or cut up miss fits. We sell Fun. Feel free to call us with any questions, we love to talk cars. We can also assist with your classic car finance options, and transport needs. Remember we love trades also. We love our business, and we love selling cars. You can see this and our entire inventory on our YOUTUBECHANNEL   COOL CLASSIC RIDES.

Summer is coming!!!! It’s time to slide behind the wheel of your new, cool, ride, and get out on the open road. We have just the way for you to do that. Available in our Showroom at Cool Classic Rides, is this really cool, and really nice 1968 Ford Torino 500, powered by a very strong running 302 v8 engine, and automatic transmission. This is not the fast back; this is the very rare 1968 hardtop. How many have you seen, if you are like us, not many? These are the forgotten Torino. Everybody knows about the fastback, but not many people know about the formal top 68 Torino. In fact this is the first one that we have ever had. This 1968 Ford is very original. It was 100% original when we purchased it in the high country of Idaho. It was wearing its original 2 tone paint, and interior, when we found it. We brought it right back to its original beauty. We had it repainted its original 2 tone color, seats are recovered, carpet and headliner are both new, and the door panels are original, in great condition. If you follow our sites, you know that we are very big fans of all the late 60s early 70s Torino’s. This car is no exception. This 1968 Ford Classic has all the right looks and moves, to stand up against the best, when it comes to late 60s cool. From her beautiful wheels, to her cool painted black top, this is a bad ass classic. If you are looking for an entry level price point to get into the world of classic cars this is a great car to look at. It is very clean, very straight, and ready to rumble, anywhere you want to go. We are pricing this great late 60s muscle car, at a very good price…. $12,500.00 this muscle car has new paint, new interior, and runs great. I do not believe anybody anyplace; can sell a better car for the money. So roll up your sleeves, and roll down your windows. Remember at Cool Classic Rides, we sell fun, cool drivers, not trailer queens. Our cars are made to drive and enjoy. Not sit in a garage. Please call with any questions 503-784-8876 Kelly or 541-420-1448 Ross. We are here to help. We can assist you with transport needs, and classic car finance options. We always recommend a private viewing or professional inspection, before you purchase. You can see all of our cars on our YOUTUBE CHANNEL COOL CLASSIC RIDES. Thank you for looking……. Enjoy The Ride……PEACE.

This sweetheart is believed to have 70,440 original miles. It's spent most of it's life in Arizona. The clean, dry original floors still show red oxide primer. This GT fastback was repainted once to bring back the original shine to the classic Wimbledon white. The interior has also been restored back to it's original condition. Loaded with all the comforts of a modern car. Power brakes and steering make this a pleasure to cruise down the road. Factory a/c has been retrofitted to 134 freeon to keep you cool on those long long summer drives. A numbers matching big block is rare enough but one this original is almost impossible to find. Here is your chance to own a true collector car!
